statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: PEGGY CRONIN CLASSIC AT CINCINNATI OH

article.headline: Bowling Green 78, Belmont 67
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Chris Knight scored 22 points in his personal homecoming as Bowling Green opened up a big first half lead before settling for a 78-67 win over Belmont Saturday. Knight, a redshirt freshman and Cincinnati native, shot 9-for-14 from the field. Sophomore Marc Larson added 14 points to reach double figures for the first time in his career. Bowling Green (1-1) started the game with an 11-0 run and led by as many as 17 four times in the first half. Matthew Dotson scored 17 points to lead the Bruins (1-1), who reached the NCAA tournament as the Atlantic Sun Conference champion each of the last two seasons. Belmont shot 51.6 percent overall and 40 percent on 3-pointers in an 86-75 win over Cincinnati Friday night, but could manage just 33.9 percent overall and 23.1 on 3-pointers against Bowling Green on Saturday. The game was part of the inaugural Peggy Cronin Classic, a three-day, six-game tournament honoring the deceased mother of second-year Cincinnati coach Mick Cronin. The four-team event concludes Sunday.
